hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubayy ibn Ka'b: The Prophet ﷺ said to him: I have been commanded to present the Qur'an to you. Ubayy said: Did your Lord mention my name to you? The Prophet ﷺ said: Yes.

chainIssues: Second chain (al-Muqaddami path) merges with first chain at Ibn Abza level
Use of 'an from al-Ajlah to Ibn Abza requires scrutiny but Asim ibn Ali is reliable narrator
Transmission term consistency: Direct terms (haddathana/thana) followed by 'an (indirect) then sami'tu (strong hearing) from companion

potential_issues.issue: Multiple transmission paths with 'an (indirect) transmission from al-Ajlah to Ibn Abza
potential_issues.impact: While both al-Ajlah and Ibn Abza are Saduq (acceptable) narrators, the use of indirect transmission ('an) introduces slight ambiguity about whether they actually met. However, given their generation proximity and general reliability, this is not a major concern.

potential_issues.issue: Convergence of two distinct chains at Ibn Abza level
potential_issues.impact: The second chain merges into the first chain at Ibn Abza and his father, which appears to be an abbreviated transmission rather than two completely independent chains.

Topics: Qur'anic recitation to Ubayy ibn Ka'b
Divine appointment of Prophet ﷺ regarding the Qur'an
Prophecy confirmation

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubayy ibn Ka'b: The Prophet ﷺ said to me: I have been commanded to recite Surah so-and-so to you. I said: Did you mention me there? He said: Yes.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Qais ibn Abbad: I used to visit Madinah during the caliphate of Umar, and I would meet companions of the Prophet ﷺ. Among them, the most beloved to me to meet was Ubayy ibn Ka'b. When the prayer was called, Umar came one day with men, and I was in the row. A man from them looked at the faces of the people as if he recognized them except me. He removed me and stood in my place, so I did not understand my prayer. When we finished the prayer, he said: Young man, do not grieve that I did not do what I did out of ignorance, but the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Be in the first row that is next to me. Then he sat and narrated hadith such that I never saw men stretching their necks towards a man facing them like that.

narrators.full_name: Umar ibn Amr ibn Abd al-Rahman al-Hamdani

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ubayy ibn Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with them both): From the Prophet ﷺ, he said: Gabriel ﷺ when he kicked Zamzam with his heel, Umm Ismail (may Allah be upon her) was gathering the dust. The Prophet ﷺ said: May Allah have mercy on Hagar or Umm Ismail, if only she had left it, it would have been a flowing spring.

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Ayyub al-Ansari was a Badr (early Muslim fighter), one of the riders of Badr. He died in the year 51 in the land of Rum and was buried beside the wall of Constantinople (may Allah be pleased with him).
